metadata.title: CVE-2022-36760 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling')vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker tosmuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issueaffects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.54 and priorversions.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
